name: ScaleChain.io
body:
### Problem
The number of Bitcoin transactions are [growing over time](https://blockchain.info/charts/n-transactions?timespan=all), but Bitcoin full nodes require to keep all transactions from genesis block. The size of blockchain is also [growing over time](https://blockchain.info/charts/blocks-size?timespan=all). Increasing block size of Bitcoin is not an ultimate solution to this problem, as Bitcoin core still needs to keep all transactions data in a  node.

### Possible Solutions
There are three ways to solve this issue.

1. Reduce database size for a node by data compression techniques.  
2. Reduce the transactions on blocks using [Sidechain](https://blockstream.com/), and off-chain transactions.
3. Distribute data across nodes. ex> [Tree-chain](https://www.mail-archive.com/bitcoin-development@lists.sourceforge.net/msg04388.html) by [Peter Todd](https://twitter.com/petertoddbtc).

In case you have an idea, feel free to visit the [Bitcoin Scalability](https://groups.google.com/d/forum/bitcoin-scalability) forum.

### About ScaleChain.io
ScaleChain.io builds a scalable blockchain infrastructure. 

### About Founder 
Kangmo Kim is the founder of ScaleChain.io. He started software development since 1988. After developing in-memory SQL database, Altibase for five years, he worked at Microsoft China for 2.5 years. After then he led a team to develop the first version of low latency( < 70us for order execution ) stock exchange in Korea Exchange, and built teams in [Korbit](http://korbit.co.kr), the first Bitcoin exchange in Korea as CTO. He believes that cryptocurrencies will change the way people spend, save and invest money in near future. 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/kangmo

### Forum
[Bitcoin Scalability](https://groups.google.com/d/forum/bitcoin-scalability) forum is for the discussion on the scalability issues of Bitcoin.
